A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
order_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

store.urls module

store.views module

store.views.cart(request)[source]

Gets all the products added to the cart by the user and displays them

Parameters:

request (obj) – The user details

Returns:

returns cart items

store.views.checkout(request)[source]

Gets the the products added to the cart and gets the total of these products. The user is then able to pay for them.

Parameters:

request (obj) – The user details

Returns:

returns checkout items

store.views.processOrder(request)[source]

Process the user’s payment and saves the date of the order

store.views.store(request)[source]

This will get all the store products and display them, as well as get the user’s details to determine if they are a customer and if they have any orders or not.

Parameters:

request (obj) – The user details

Returns:

the main store page

store.views.updateItem(request)[source]

Allows the user to remove items from the cart
